column4: Grok_::  soundjuicer is pretty easy to use + efficient from what i have done
I need to install qt 4.1.4 with an archive .tar.gz, and i need someone help for it ...
lipe::  ok... so, you're compling from source code?
lipe::  first, make sure you have dependencies.. sudo apt-get build-dep qt4-dev-tools
lipe::  then extract the archive -- tar zxvf {qt.tar.gz file name}, then ./configure, then sudo make, then sudo make install
: Package xlibmesa-gl-dev has no installation candidate
lipe::  that *could* be a problem... not definitely, though
huhmm. how can i solve that ?!
lipe::  you can try to ./configure it w/o downloading dependencies, and see what you need
i already tryied it, but qt isn't installed correctly
i think that my qt is 3.x.x ... and after compiling it, it continues the same
lipe::  you can sudo apt-cache search qt *replace qt with any dependencies you need to find packages that match
lemme try it, thx u very much !
hexi ... i need to compile it in a especific directory ??
lipe::  no... it'll find the directories it needs
